com.google.publicalerts.cap.profile

Interface CapProfile

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCapProfile, AustralianProfile, CanadianProfile, GoogleProfile, Ipaws1Profile

    public interface CapProfile
    Specifies a set of extra constraints on the CAP format.

    The constraints are usually country-specific.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCode()
      Returns a code unique to the profile.
      java.lang.String getDocumentationUrl()
      Returns the canonical URL of the official document describing the profile.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the profile, suitable for display.
      Reasons validate(AlertOrBuilder alert)
      Checks the given alert against the profile and returns a collection of: errors explaining how the alert does not match the profile, recommendations and best-practices recommended by the profile to improve the alert.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the profile, suitable for display.
        Returns:
        the name of the profile

      • getCode

        java.lang.String getCode()
        Returns a code unique to the profile. Ideally, it will include a version number.
        Returns:
        a unique code identifying the profile

      • getDocumentationUrl

        java.lang.String getDocumentationUrl()
        Returns the canonical URL of the official document describing the profile.
        Returns:
        the documentation url

      • validate

        Reasons validate(AlertOrBuilder alert)
        Checks the given alert against the profile and returns a collection of:
        • errors explaining how the alert does not match the profile,
        • recommendations and best-practices recommended by the profile to improve the alert.

        The profile should assume that the given alert is valid CAP and check only the extra constraints it specifies.

        An alert not adhering to the recommendations and best-practices would still be accepted by whatever system that claims to require alerts adhering to the profile, but adopting the recommendations allows for more full compatibility and perhaps extra features.

        Parameters:
        alert - the alert to validate
        Returns:
        errors and recommendations found during the validation, an empty collection if there are none
